title: Dickie Davies, host of ITV's World of Sport for nearly two decades, dies
description: The presenter famously anchored the five-hour live TV marathon every Saturday between 1968 and 1985.

title: Son Heung-min: Tottenham condemn 'utterly reprehensible' racist abuse aimed at forward
description: Tottenham call for social media companies to take action after Son Heung-min is subjected to "utterly reprehensible" racist abuse online.

title: Tottenham 2-0 West Ham: Son Heung-min proves point after being dropped to bench
description: Son Heung-min proves a point with Tottenham's second goal against West Ham after being left out of the starting line-up.

title: Women's T20 World Cup: New Zealand thrash Sri Lanka to keep semi-final hopes alive
description: New Zealand keep their hopes of reaching the Women's T20 World Cup semi-finals alive with a dominant 102-run win over Sri Lanka.

title: Rachel Daly: Has versatile player staked claim to be England's number nine?
description: Rachel Daly's double against Italy has further strengthened the versatile player's claim to be England's number nine.

title: Tottenham 2-0 West Ham: Emerson Royal and Son Heung-min goals take Spurs into Premier League top four
description: Tottenham move into the top four of the Premier League thanks to a home victory over struggling West Ham, who remain in the relegation zone.

title: UK Athletics Indoor Championships 2023: Ellie Baker wins 1500m in new championship record
description: Ellie Baker breaks Zola Budd's 1500m championship record from 1986 to win gold at the UK Athletics Indoor Championships in Birmingham.

title: Manchester United 3-0 Leicester: Erik ten Hag rallies fans before pivotal week
description: Manchester United face their biggest week under Erik ten Hag, playing Barcelona in the Europa League play-off and Newcastle in the Carabao Cup final.

title: England 2-1 Italy: Rachel Daly double helps England avoid Italy scare
description: Rachel Daly scores twice as England survive a scare from Italy in Coventry to win their second match of the Arnold Clark Cup.

title: Baftas 2023: The red carpet in pictures
description: Viola Davis, Michelle Yeoh and Eddie Redmayne are among the stars gathering in London for the ceremony.

title: British Medical Association calls government reckless over pay talks
description: BMA members have been balloted over a junior doctors strike, with the result expected on Monday,

title: Strikes update: How Monday 20 February’s walkouts will affect you
description: What you need to know about ambulance and Border Force workers' strikes, by the BBC's Zoe Conway.

title: Meta to introduce paid-for verification for Instagram
description: The move comes after Twitter introduced a subscription-based verification service last year.

title: Turkey earthquake: Rescue effort ends in all but two areas
description: Searches will only continue in Kahramanmaras and Hatay, the country's disaster agency said.

title: Man Utd 3-0 Leicester: Marcus Rashford and Jadon Sancho score as Red Devils win
description: Marcus Rashford continues his hot streak of form by scoring twice to help Manchester United overcome Leicester in the Premier League.

title: Co-op cuts best before dates from 150 fruit and veg products
description: Shoppers will be asked to use their judgement as to whether fruit and veg has gone off.

title: Nicola Bulley police find a body in river
description: Police searching for the missing mother-of two say they have found a body in the river

title: Manchester United sale: Bids from Ineos and Qataris raise 'questions'
description: The Manchester United Supporters' Trust says the two bids made for the club raise questions about sporting integrity, debt levels and inclusivity.

title: Turkey earthquake: Red balloons placed on rubble to honour child victims
description: A group of volunteers tie tributes to metal wires sticking out of destroyed buildings in Hatay.

title: Funeral fund: ‘Nobody prepares for the death of a child’
description: More than 100 families have applied for a fund to help pay a child's funeral cost since June 2022.

title: Nicola Bulley: Roads closed in search for missing mum
description: Police have shut roads near the area where the mother-of-two disappeared three weeks ago.

title: Aberhosan: Farmer dies and son seriously injured in accident
description: Residents are described as being in shock, with a concert cancelled as a mark of respect.

title: Exeter: Man held over murder of woman in Ludwell Valley Park
description: Police launch a murder investigation after a woman dies in a suspected knife attack.

title: Jeff Koons: Visitor breaks iconic balloon dog sculpture in Miami
description: The iconic Balloon Dog was knocked to the ground by an art collector in Miami.

title: Leigh Wood v Mauricio Lara: Briton loses world title with stoppage defeat in thrilling fight
description: Watch highlights as Leigh Wood loses his WBA featherweight title to Mauricio Lara in a thrilling fight in Nottingham.

title: Brexit: Protocol deal must work for all of Northern Ireland - Mordaunt
description: The Commons leader also says an intervention by Boris Johnson on the issue is not "entirely unhelpful".

title: UK defence spending is top priority, says Mordaunt
description: Penny Mordaunt says the government has committed to increasing its defence spending to support Ukraine.

title: Nicola Bulley search: Mordaunt says health revelations 'sexist' and 'shocking'
description: Commons leader says disclosure of Nicola Bulley's health "really does grate with a lot of women".

title: Hugh Jackman wants to score winner versus Wrexham
description: The Hollywood actor says he wants to "stick it" to Ryan Reynolds by scoring the winning goal.

title: China may give Russia weapons for Ukraine war, Anthony Blinken warns
description: The US secretary of state said Beijing was considering "lethal support" for Russia in Ukraine.

title: India v Australia: Ravindra Jadeja takes 7-42 as hosts win second Test
description: India retain the Border-Gavaskar trophy as Australia slip to defeat inside three days in the second Test in Delhi.

title: England in New Zealand: Ben Stokes' side have become serial winners
description: England have made winning a habit after setting out to entertain and there is still room to improve, says chief cricket writer Stephan Shemilt.

title: Genesis Invitational: Jon Rahm leads as Tiger Woods improves
description: Spain's Jon Rahm moves closer to regaining the world number one spot as he opens up a three-shot lead at the Genesis Invitational in California.

title: Leigh Wood v Mauricio Lara: Briton loses world title with stoppage defeat in thrilling fight
description: Leigh Wood's reign as WBA featherweight champion is over after the Briton loses to hard-hitting Mauricio Lara in Nottingham.

title: Environment: Are mushroom boards the future of surfing?
description: Steve Davies hopes to address the surfing industry's environmental impact - with mushrooms.

title: Welsh Open: Shaun Murphy will face Robert Milkins in final
description: Shaun Murphy will face European series-chasing Robert Milkins in Sunday's Welsh Open final in Llandudno.

title: The Papers: Johnson ready to derail PM's plan and 'eviction for Andrew'
description: Former PM says it is a mistake to scrap NI Protocol bill and Duke of York might lose £30m mansion after grant cut.

title: NI Protocol: Boris Johnson warns Rishi Sunak not to drop power to override Brexit deal
description: The ex-PM says ditching powers that allow the UK to change post-Brexit trade deal would be a "mistake".

title: Five killed in Israeli strike on Damascus, Syria says
description: Syria's army says a soldier is among the dead, after rockets hit a high-security area of the capital.

title: New Zealand v England: Tourists win first Test by 267 runs
description: England swiftly wrap up a superb 267-run victory over New Zealand on the fourth day of the first Test in Mount Maunganui.

title: Humza Yousaf and Ash Regan launch bids to become SNP leader
description: The first two candidates to replace Nicola Sturgeon as Scotland's first minister announce their bids.

title: Baftas 2023: Stars gather for ceremony as awards season intensifies
description: Richard E Grant will host this year's ceremony on BBC One from London's Royal Festival Hall.

title: Ukraine war: Russia must be defeated but not crushed, Macron says
description: The French president reaffirms support for Kyiv but hints that talks with Russia are a final goal.

title: Ghana President Nana Akufo-Addo's cathedral plan stalls amid economic crisis
description: Ghana is seeking a $3bn loan from the IMF but the president is pushing ahead with a huge new cathedral.

title: Ukraine War: 'Everyone is kind, but the fact is, we're not home'
description: Poland has welcomed millions of Ukrainians fleeing Russia's war, but many want their old lives back.

title: BFM journalist Rachid M'Barki suspended in scandal linked to disinformation firm
description: Veteran presenter Rachid M'Barki is accused of running stories planted by an Israel-based organisation.
